member.name: T:Ace.Server.AceSight.Operations.Skills.Definition.ICustomInputSource
member.summary: Provides custom input options for user to select from and translates user input for custom sources.
member.remarks:
Some skill have custom inputs, meaning their available options cannot be provided by simply knowing the input type.
Normal inputs are something like a value type or a simple reference (e.g. ).
Custom inputs require fetching multiple options based on other inputs. For example:
- A variable drop-down that requires fetching data from a controller
- A list of available gripper tips based on the selected end-effector

member.name: M:Ace.Server.AceSight.Calibration.IRobotCameraCalibrationBase.ComputePictureLocation(Ace.Server.Transform3D,Ace.Server.Transform3D)
member.summary:
Computes a robot location to which the robot can move for a given target location in world and vision coordinates. Given the location of the target in world coordinates, and the desired location for it to appear in vision coordinates:
Using an intelligent guess for picture location, find the error in tool coordinates between the computed target location and the actual target location.
member.param: Estimated location of target in world coordinates.
Desired location of target in vision coordinates.

member.param: The transformation identifying the location in world coordinates.
member.returns: the relative transformation from the robot tip to the input transformation

member.summary: Gets or sets the motion parameters for the move, including speeds, accelerations, etc.

member.summary: Configuration of the move, used to resolve redundancies, such as when locations can be reached in multiple ways. For simple robots, this value may be null.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters
member.summary: Trajectory parameters controlling a motion, such as speed, accel, blending, etc.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.Speed
member.summary: Get or set the motion speed. Must be greater than 0, with 100 representing rated speed.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.RotationalSpeed
member.summary: Get or set the motion speed. Must be greater than 0, with 100 representing rated speed.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.SpeedMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the straight-line speed mode. This parameter is ignored for non-straight moves, for which speed is always a percent.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.Accel
member.summary: Get or set the motion acceleration. Must be greater than 0, with 100 representing full acceleration.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.Decel
member.summary: Get or set the motion deceleration. Must be greater than 0, with 100 representing full deceleration.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.Duration
member.summary: Get or set the minimum motion duration (sec). The actual motion duration may be longer if limited by the commanded speeds and accelerations.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.SCurveProfile
member.summary: Get or set the S-curve profile number, from 0 (for trapezoidal) to 8, or -1 to leave unchanged.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.Straight
member.summary: Get or set a flag indicating whether the motion should be straight-line. If false, motion will be joint-interpolated.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.MotionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the way to end a move: whether to complete move without nulling errors (NoNull), blend, or settle.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.SettlePercent
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of the nominal settling distance to use. This is only used if the "Motion End" property is set to "Settle Fine" or "Settle Coarse".

member.name: M:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.Clone
member.summary: Returns a copy of this object.

member.name: M:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.IMoveParameters.GetFlagString(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Return the flags as a string.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.MotionEnd
member.summary: An enumeration of ways to end a motion.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.MotionEnd.NoNull
member.summary: Set to report the move is complete as soon as the move completes, without blending or settling.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.MotionEnd.Blend
member.summary: Set to blend this motion into the subsequent one if the subsequent motion is commanded before deceleration of this motion begins. Clear to complete this motion before starting the next.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.MotionEnd.SettleFine
member.summary: Set to settle to within the settling tolerance before starting the next motion. If this bit is set, then the blend bit should be cleared.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.MotionEnd.SettleCoarse
member.summary: Set to settle to within the settling tolerance before starting the next motion. If this bit is set, then the blend bit should be cleared.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.MoveSpeedMode
member.summary: An enumeration of possible move speed modes.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.MoveSpeedMode.Percent
member.summary: Move speed is expressed as a percent of the nominal speed.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.MoveSpeedMode.Mmps
member.summary: Move speed is expressed in millimeters per second. Only used for straight-line motions; ignored for joint-interpolated motions.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.MoveSpeedMode.Ips
member.summary: Move speed is expressed in inches per second. Only used for straight-line motions; ignored for joint-interpolated motions.

member.summary: Legitimate choices to resolve wrist configuration redundancies.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motion.SingleMultipleMode.Single
member.summary: A flag indicating that, during the next move, the wrist is limited to motion in the range +/- 180 degrees.

member.summary: Set the specified motors to run independently of the trajectory generator or as part of the robot. Note that this function turns off automatic control (detaches) the robot. If you wish to control the robot setting the motor independent mask you must set AutomaticControlActive to true.
member.param: Bit mask with bit set for each motor to modify (bit 0 for motor 1, etc.).
Bit mask with bit set for each motor to make independent and clear to make dependent.

member.summary: The motor calibration parameters.

member.name: M:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.SetOpcode(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Writes an opcode to the servos (not copied to V+ master opcode list).

member.name: M:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.WaveConfigure(System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Configure wave generation.
member.param: A flag set to true for a sine wave, false for a square wave.
Amplitude (cts). Total motion will be twice the amplitude.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.WaveEnable
member.summary: Gets or sets the wave-enable state. Currently, "get" returns 0.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.MaximumOutputLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum output command to the motors (32767 is max).

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.MaximumManualModeOutputLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum output command to the motors (32767 is max) when in manual control mode.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.DutyCycleOutputLimit1
member.summary: Gets or sets the filtered output command limit a duty cycle error will be declared. This should be less than MaximumOutputLevel.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.DutyCycleFilterPole1
member.summary: Gets or sets the *Duty cycle exceeded* low-pass filter pole. A high value will increase the time constant used the duty-cycle filter to declare *Duty-cycle exceeded* errors. A value of 9 is typical.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.DutyCycleOutputLimit2
member.summary: Gets or sets the filtered output command limit a duty cycle error will be declared. This should be less than MaximumOutputLevel.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.DutyCycleFilterPole2
member.summary: Gets or sets the *Duty cycle exceeded* low-pass filter pole. A high value will increase the time constant used the duty-cycle filter to declare *Duty-cycle exceeded* errors. A value of 9 is typical.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.DutyCycleOutputLimit3
member.summary: Gets or sets the filtered output command limit a duty cycle error will be declared. This should be less than MaximumOutputLevel.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.DutyCycleFilterPole3
member.summary: Gets or sets the *Duty cycle exceeded* low-pass filter pole. A high value will increase the time constant used the duty-cycle filter to declare *Duty-cycle exceeded* errors. A value of 9 is typical.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.LastMotionSettlingTime
member.summary: The motor settling time, in milliseconds, for the last motion completed.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.VoltageOverheadOptimization
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag enabling higher motor speeds by automatically offsetting the amplifier's PWM duty-cycle values in order to maximize the voltage that can be applied to the motor windings. This can increase the maximum motor speed by as much as 13%.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.SoftEnvelopeErrorLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the *Soft envelope error* limit (cts). When the position error exceeds this value, V+ decelerates the robot to a controlled stop.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.HardEnvelopeErrorLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the *Hard envelope error* limit (cts). When the position error exceeds this value, the servos immediately shut down the amplifier and engage the brakes.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.VelocityEnvelopeErrorLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the velocity envelope error limit (cts/msec). When the velocity error exceeds this value, a *Hard envelope error* is declared.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.ManualModeEnvelopeErrorLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a special *Soft envelope error* limit (cts). When the position error exceeds this value in manual mode, V+ decelerates the robot to a controlled stop.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.ReverseTorque
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the torque output command. Exercise care when changing this value--the wrong value can cause the motor to run away.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.ReverseCommutation
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the motor phase commutation order. Exercise care when changing this value--the wrong value can cause the motor to run away.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.EncoderConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets encoder configuration flags.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.InputPolarityConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets motor input polarity flags.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.MotorStalledTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time (sec) in which a *Motor stalled timeout* will be declared if the output level remains saturated at its limiting value.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.ZeroIndexSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of encoder counts between zero indexes (zero to disable).

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.ReverseEncoder
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of positive encoder counting. Exercise care when changing this value--the wrong value can cause the motor to run away.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.DefaultMotionSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the default motion speed (cts/ms) for motor moves. This is normally used when directly giving move commands to the motors.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.DefaultAccelTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the default acceleration time (msec) for motor moves. This is normally used when directly giving move commands to the motors.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.CoarseNullingTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets the COARSE nulling tolerance (cts). Requires "fast" system initialization to take effect.

member.summary: Gets or sets the time required to be in tolerance (sec).

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotor.ToleranceFilterPole
member.summary: Gets or sets the settling tolerance filter pole.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorBase
member.summary: A class representing motors in an Adept system.

member.summary: Gets a motor status object.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorBase.IsAlive
member.summary: True if communication to the motor is operational, false if not. In general, if no motor "gadget" is mapped to this motor on the device nodes, it will be disabled.

member.name: M:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorBase.MotorCommand(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Double[])
member.summary: Send a low-level motor command to V+. Do not use this function unless you know what you're doing!
member.param: True to execute the command synchronously with robot motion; false otherwise.
Array of data to send to servos.
member.returns: Array of data returned by servos.

member.name: M:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorBase.GetOpcode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads an opcode from the servos.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorBase.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the current motor position. The preferred way to set the position during calibration is to use the AdjustPosition command, since there is no gap in time between getting and setting position that can result in minor position errors.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorBase.PositionError
member.summary: Gets the current motor position error (commanded position - actual position), in counts.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorBase.IndexDelta
member.summary: Gets the distance between the last two index pulses, in counts.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorBase.OutputLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the commanded motor output, from -32768 to 32767. Be careful setting the commanded output--can cause the motor to take off.

member.summary: Gets the device node to which this motor belongs.

member.summary: Gets the gadget number on the device node to which this motor belongs.

member.summary: 0-based index of the motor within the robot.

member.summary: Gets the encoder alarm.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorBase.IsSecondary
member.summary: Gets the secondary flag.

member.summary: Is Yaskawa encoder.

member.summary: Is Mitsubishi encoder.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains
member.summary: Motor gains.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.Motor
member.summary: Gets the motor associated with this gain set.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.ProportionalGain
member.summary: Gets or sets the servo proportional gain. Higher gain causes "tighter" servo control, considered good until it is so high that oscillation begins.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.Zero
member.summary: Gets or sets the zero in the feedback loop. It provides low-pass filtering of the feedback signal, which can eliminate some noise but can also cause instability. Typically, this is set to a value between 0 and 1.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.Pole
member.summary: Gets or sets the pole in the feedback loops. Values close to 1 (but below 1) provide damping, which helps stabilize the feedback loop.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.IntegratorGain
member.summary: Gets or sets the feedback loop integrator gain, used to eliminate steady-state errors. It produces a torque proportional to the sum (integral) of all previous errors. Too low a value can cause errors to take a long time to go to zero. Too high a value can cause oscillations that never damp out.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.MaxIntegratorValue
member.summary: A limit on the accumulated error that the integrator will achieve, in output counts from 0 to 32767. A value of 0 disables the integrator. A higher value increases possible integrator action. A value of 32767 is appropriate in most cases.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.MaxPositionErrorToIntegrate
member.summary: Gets or sets the largest position error to integrate (cts) per servo cycle. This effectively decreases the integrator gain for errors larger than this value, helping prevent integrator "windup".

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.CompensatorGain
member.summary: Gets or sets a multiplier applied at the end of the control loop.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.VelocityFeedforward
member.summary: Gets or sets the velocity feed-forward gain (output/(cts/msec)). This outputs a torque proportional to commanded velocity. It can reduce tracking errors on systems with significant viscous friction. Since it is a feedforward gain, it has no effect on stability.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.AccelerationFeedforward
member.summary: Gets or sets the acceleration feed-forward gain (output/(cts/msec^2)). This outputs a torque proportional to commanded acceleration. It can reduce tracking errors on systems with significant mass. Since it is a feedforward gain, it has no effect on stability.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.DacOutputFilterPole
member.summary: Gets or sets a low-pass smoothing filter pole on the output command. Typically, this is kept at 0; on some systems with high-frequency resonances, a value of 1 or 2 may be acceptable. Higher values tend to cause low-frequency oscillation.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.AdaptiveFeedforwardControl
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether single-axis adaptive feedforward control is used. If enabled, velocity and acceleration feedforward are disabled.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.SecondOrderFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets second-order filter parameters, in the form 'poleFrequency dampingRatio'. If poleFrequency is zero, the second-order filter is disabled. If poleFrequency is non-zero and dampingRatio is zero, a low-pass filter is created. If both are non-zero, a notch filter is created.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.StaticFrictionFeedforwardMaximumTrigger
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum commanded speed (cts/msec) that will saturate the static friction compensation torque to the maximum positive or negative value. Set this value to 0 to disable static friction compensation.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.StaticFrictionFeedforwardMinimumTrigger
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum commanded speed (cts/msec) at which the static friction compensation torque will begin to take effect.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.StaticFrictionFeedforwardMaximumPositiveValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum positive static friction torque value. Typically, this is the same as the maximum negative value. The full value will be achieved at positive speeds exceeding the maximum trigger value.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.StaticFrictionFeedforwardMaximumNegativeValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum negative static friction torque value. Typically, this is the same as the maximum positive value. The full value will be achieved at negative speeds below the maximum trigger value.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.IMotorGains.StaticFrictionFeedforwardTimeConstant
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount by which the static friction compensation leads or lags the commanded velocity.
member.remarks: If the value is positive, the static friction compensation will lead the servo set point. If the value is negative, the static friction compensation will be delayed compared to the commanded velocity. This allows the static friction feedforward compensation to be synchronized, as much as possible, with commanded velocity.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Motors.ISecondaryEncoder
member.summary: An Interface representing secondary encoder in an Adept system.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Obstacles.Obstacle
member.summary: A robot obstacle. Depending on the configuration, the robot tool tip must remain external to the obstacle, or internal to it. An error is generated if the tool tip contacts the obstacle.
member.remarks:
Obstacle types and dimensions:
Box with center at Dimension0=X, Dimension1=Y, Dimension2=Z.
Cylinder with Dimension0=Radius, Dimension1=Height along Z.
Sphere with Dimension0=Radius.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Obstacles.Obstacle.IsDefault
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the obstacle is at a default/uninitialized state.
member.value: true if this instance is default; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Obstacles.Obstacle.IsContainment
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the obstacle is a containment obstacle.
member.value: true if this instance represents a containment shape; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Safety.IEStopSafetyConfiguration
member.summary: Interface for configuring ESTOP hardware delay

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Safety.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.NominalHardwareDelay
member.summary: Nominal value for the delay (in ms) across safety circuit. The observed delay should be within a specified range of the default delay, if this value has not be overridden by the user after the robot was commissioned at the factory.
member.remarks: The nominal delay might be very different from the observed delay based on the resistor value that was set during commissioning.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Safety.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.NominalResolution
member.summary: Nominal resolution is the amount of additional delay achieved by incrementing the resistor value by 1.
member.remarks: Empirical data shows that this resolution value is around 75/32 = 2.34375. This value is rounded off to 3.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Safety.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.AcceptableHardwareDelayDeviation
member.summary: The acceptable delay deviation (in ms) is used to determine the acceptable range for the observed delay.
member.remarks: This value usually depends on the pots and the millisecond resolution that can be achieved. The acceptable range for the observed delay is between (DefaultHardwareDelay - AcceptableHardwareDelayDeviation) and (DefaultHardwareDelay + AcceptableHardwareDelayDeviation)

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.Safety.IEStopSafetyConfiguration.MinResistorValue
member.summary: Minimum programmable resistor value

member.summary: Maximum programmable resistor value

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.IRobotTimingSpecs
member.summary: Encapsulates robot timing specifications.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.IRobotTimingSpecs.AutoModeEStopShutdownTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time (sec) after an auto mode E-stop is asserted in which case V+ is allowed to decelerate the robot, engage the brakes, and shutdown power before the servo nodes automatically shut down power. Values range from 0 (immediate power off) to 0.512 seconds. If E-stop hardware delay is configured, then the maximum value allowed is 16 ms less than the E-stop hardware delay. If the deceleration is too slow or the brake-on delay too long, the servo node will automatically cut power.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.IRobotTimingSpecs.BrakeEngageDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay (in sec) from the moment the brakes are engaged until servo control is disabled. This helps prevent the robot from dropping due to the time it takes the brakes to fully engage.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.IRobotTimingSpecs.BrakeReleaseDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay (in sec) from the moment brakes are released until the trajectory generator starts moving the robot. This helps prevent the robot from moving prematurely while the brakes are still partially engaged.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.IRobotTimingSpecs.DriveEnableTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time (sec) that V+ will wait after enabling the amplifier for it to indicate that it has successfully enabled. A *Timeout enabling amplifier* will occur if the timeout expires.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.IRobotTimingSpecs.HoldToRunEStopShutdownTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time (sec) after a hold-to-run mode E-stop is asserted in which V+ is allowed to decelerate the robot, engage the brakes, and shutdown power before the servo nodes automatically shut down power. Values range from 0 (immediate power off) to 0.512 seconds. If the deceleration is too slow or the brake-on delay too long, the servo node will automatically cut power.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.IRobotTimingSpecs.ManualModeEStopShutdownTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the time (sec) after a manual mode E-stop is asserted in which V+ is allowed to decelerate the robot, engage the brakes, and shutdown power before the servo nodes automatically shut down power. Values range from 0 (immediate power off) to 0.512 seconds. If E-stop hardware delay is configured, then the maximum value allowed is 16 ms less than the E-stop hardware delay. If the deceleration is too slow or the brake-on delay too long, the servo node will automatically cut power.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.IRobotTimingSpecs.MaxTimeToWaitForAmpPower
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time (sec) that V+ will wait for the servos to indicate successful power-up after enabling power. A *Timeout enabling high power* will occur if the timeout expires.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.IRobotTimingSpecs.NullingTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds the controller will wait for nulling position errors (getting within the COARSE or FINE tolerance on all motors) before declaring a *Time-out nulling error*.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.IRobotTimingSpecs.PowerOnToAmpOnDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay (sec) from the time high power is turned on until the amplifiers are enabled. This allows the amplifiers time to reset.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.IRobotTimingSpecs.Robot
member.summary: Gets the robot associated with this parameter set.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.SCurveProfile
member.summary: A description of a V+ S-curve profile. An S-curve can smooth the trajectory into an "S" shape by limiting the rate of change of acceleration. Robots with flexible links or drive trains can benefit from S-curves to reduce oscillation.
member.remarks: An S-curve profile is defined by the ramp-up and ramp-down times during the acceleration and deceleration phases. S-curve profile 0 is the default trapezoidal velocity profile, with ramp-up and ramp-down times all zero. Profile 0 results in the fastest but least smooth motions. Profiles 1-8 may be defined to get smoother motions by lengthening the ramp-up and ramp-down times.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.SCurveProfile.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether this profile is enabled.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.SCurveProfile.AccelerationRampUpTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the acceleration ramp-up time, in seconds.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.SCurveProfile.AccelerationRampDownTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the acceleration ramp-down time, in seconds.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.SCurveProfile.DecelerationRampUpTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the deceleration ramp-up time, in seconds.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.SCurveProfile.DecelerationRampDownTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the deceleration ramp-down time, in seconds.

member.name: M:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.SCurveProfile.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this profile.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState
member.summary: Robot trajectory states.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.Idle
member.summary: Trajectory complete.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.AccelRampUp
member.summary: Robot is ramping up acceleration as it starts a new motion. This state is only entered if S-curves are used.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.ConstantAccel
member.summary: Robot is accelerating as it starts a new motion.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.AccelRampDown
member.summary: Robot is ramping down acceleration as it starts a new motion. This state is only entered if S-curves are used.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.ConstantVelocity
member.summary: Constant velocity section of motion is active.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.BlendRampUp
member.summary: Robot is ramping up acceleration as it blends into a new motion. This state is only entered if S-curves are used.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.ConstantBlend
member.summary: Robot is accelerating into a new motion.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.BlendRampDown
member.summary: Robot is ramping down acceleration as it blends into a new motion. This state is only entered if S-curves are used.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.DecelRampUp
member.summary: Robot is ramping up deceleration as it completes a motion. This state is only entered if S-curves are used.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.ConstantDecel
member.summary: Robot is decelerating as it completes a motion.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.DecelRampDown
member.summary: Robot is ramping down deceleration as it completes a motion. This state is only entered if S-curves are used.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Adept.Robots.TrajectoryState.Settling
member.summary: Trajectory complete, but robot is not yet in tolerance.

member.name: M:Ace.Server.Adept.Controllers.IAdeptController.InvokeVPlusProgram(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Invoke a generic V+ program. The V+ program must be of the form .PROGRAM my_prog() Note that the program should not run for a long period of time, since it will hang one of the communication tasks. In that case, you should use ExecuteVPlusInstruction with an argument of "EXECUTE n my_prog()", to start the long-running program in its own task. Parameters may be passed and returned from the program using global variables, together with the GetRealValue to get values and ExecuteVPlusInstruction to set values.
member.param: Number of the robot command queue in which to execute. These do NOT correspond to V+ task numbers. Use 1 for robot 1's queue, 2 for robot 2's queue, etc. Use 0 for a non-robot queue.
Name of the program to invoke.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Core.ICartesianObject
member.summary: An object in the work cell with a Cartesian location. Objects that extend this class may build a "scene graph" of connections to define their location. For example, a robot may be mounted to a table, an end-effector to the robot, and a part attached to the end-effector. So the location of the object may be determined by appending the location of its parent (if any) with its offset. Cartesian objects may be rendered in 3D simulations.
member.remarks: A user application will typically not use this interface.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Core.ICartesianObject.ParentLocation
member.summary: World location of the parent of this object, or the identity transform if this object has no parent.

member.summary: The offset from the tip of the parent object (or the world origin if the parent is null) to the base of this object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the world location of the object.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Core.IVisualizable.Parent
member.summary: The parent of this object, or null if it is relative to the world origin. The parent is the object to which this object is attached--if the parent moves, so do all of its children.

member.summary: The polarity of line finding

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LineFinderPolarity.DarkToLight
member.summary: Look for Dark to Light Transitions The Line Finder searches only for line light transition in greylevel values.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LineFinderPolarity.LightToDark
member.summary: Look for Light to Dark Transitions: The Line Finder searches only for line instances occurring at a light to dark transition in greylevel values.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LineFinderPolarity.Either
member.summary: Look for either Dark to Light or Light to Dark Transitions: The Line Finder searches only for line instances occurring either at a light to dark or dark to light transition in greylevel values.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LineFinderPolarity.DoNotCare
member.summary: Do not care: The Line Finder searches only for line instances occurring at any transition in greylevel values including reversals in contrast along the line, for example on an unevenly colored background.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration
member.summary: Locator Contour detection parameter configuration

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.parametersBasedOn
member.summary: Sets how the contour detection parameters are configured. When set to hsContourParametersAllModels, the contour detection parameters are optimized by analyzing the parameters used to build all the models. When set to hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters are set manually. When set to a value greater than hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters of a specific model are used. The contour detection parameters on which this property has an effect are DetailLevel, OutlineLevel, ContrastThresholdMode, and ContrastThreshold

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.ParametersBasedOn
member.summary: Sets how the contour detection parameters are configured. When set to hsContourParametersAllModels, the contour detection parameters are optimized by analyzing the parameters used to build all the models. When set to hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters are set manually. When set to a value greater than hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters of a specific model are used. The contour detection parameters on which this property has an effect are DetailLevel, OutlineLevel, ContrastThresholdMode, and ContrastThreshold

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.outlineLevel
member.summary: The coarseness of the contours at the Outline level. This property can only be set when ParametersBasedOn is set to hsParametersCustom. Read only otherwise.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.OutlineLevel
member.summary: The coarseness of the contours at the Outline level. This property can only be set when ParametersBasedOn is set to hsParametersCustom. Read only otherwise.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.detailLevel
member.summary: The coarseness of the contours at the Detail level. This property can only be set when ParametersBasedOn is set to hsParametersCustom. Read only otherwise

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.DetailLevel
member.summary: The coarseness of the contours at the Detail level. This property can only be set when ParametersBasedOn is set to hsParametersCustom. Read only otherwise

member.summary: The tracking inertia setting used to detect the contours of the model.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContourDetectionConfiguration.TrackingInertia

member.summary: Contour parameter for locator tool

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContourParameter.AllModels
member.summary: The contour detection parameters are optimized by analyzing the parameters used to build all the models

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContourParameter.Custom
member.summary: The contour detection parameters are set manually.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContrastPolarity
member.summary: Contrast polarity mode for locator tool

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContrastPolarity.Normal
member.summary: Normal contrast search

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContrastPolarity.Reverse
member.summary: Reverse contrast search

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContrastPolarity.NormalAndReverse
member.summary: Normal and reverse search

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorContrastPolarity.DoNotCare
member.summary: Do not care

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorInstanceOrdering
member.summary: Ordering of instances of locator tool

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorInstanceOrdering.Evidence
member.summary: Instances are processed and output according to their hypothesis strength, beginning with the strongest hypothesis.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorInstanceOrdering.LeftToRight
member.summary: Instances are processed and output in the order they appear in the search area, from left to right.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorInstanceOrdering.RightToLeft
member.summary: Instances are processed and output in the order they appear in the search area, from right to left.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorInstanceOrdering.TopToBottom
member.summary: Instances are processed and output in the order they appear in the search area, from top to bottom.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorInstanceOrdering.BottomToTop
member.summary: Instances are processed and output in the order they appear in the search area, from bottom to top.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorInstanceOrdering.Quality
member.summary: All the instances are first processed and then they are output according to their Quality, beginning with the highest quality.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorInstanceOrdering.DistanceImage
member.summary: Instances are processed and output according to their distance from a reference image coordinate, beginning with the closest.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.LocatorInstanceOrdering.DistanceWorld
member.summary: Instances are processed and output according to their distance from a reference world coordinate, beginning with the closest.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.BlobSegmentationMode
member.summary: Defines the search mode/segmentation mode for a blob analyzer operation

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.BlobSegmentationMode.Light
member.summary: Light Segmentation
member.remarks: The Light segmentation algorithm outputs all pixels with values higher than the threshold value as blob pixels. Pixels with values below the threshold become background pixels. This mode is used for light blobs on a dark background.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.BlobSegmentationMode.Dark
member.summary: Dark Segmentation Mode
member.remarks: The Dark segmentation algorithm is the inverse function of the Light segmentation algorithm. The Blob Analyzer outputs all pixels with values below the threshold value as blob pixels. Pixels with values above the threshold become background pixels. This mode is used for dark blobs on a light background.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.BlobSegmentationMode.Inside
member.summary: Inside segmentation mode

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.BlobSegmentationMode.Outside
member.summary: Outside segmentation mode

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.BlobSegmentationMode.DynamicLight
member.summary: Dynamic Light Segmentation
member.remarks: Dynamic thresholding provides an adaptive thresholding mode, particularly useful when there are lighting variations from one instance to another. A dynamic threshold sets a percentage of the pixel distribution (histogram) to be considered as blob pixels.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Parameters.BlobSegmentationMode.DynamicDark
member.summary: Dynamic Dark Segmentation
member.remarks: Dynamic thresholding provides an adaptive thresholding mode, particularly useful when there are lighting variations from one instance to another. A dynamic threshold sets a percentage of the pixel distribution (histogram) to be considered as blob pixels.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator3D.Locator3DInstance.Position
member.summary: InstanceLocation returns the location of the selected instance, in the frame of reference of the specified robot. If a gripper offset has been assigned to the instance, it is automatically applied to the location. If no robot-to-vision calibration has been carried out, InstanceLocation returns the location in the Vision frame of reference.

member.summary: Index of the model located

member.summary: The object id of the model

member.summary: Name of the model located

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator3D.Locator3DInstance.MatchScore
member.summary: The match score as a combination of the gradient and normal score. Match quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that 100% of the model contours were successfully matched to the actual contours detected in the input image.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator3D.Locator3DInstance.GradientScore
member.summary: The collation score calculated from the gradient direction feature. The degree of how closely the contour of the object matches the model. Match quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that 100% of the model contours were successfully matched to the actual contours detected in the input image.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator3D.Locator3DInstance.NormalScore
member.summary: The collation score calculated from the normal direction feature. The degree of how closely the surface shape of the object matches the model. Match quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that 100% of the model contours were successfully matched to the actual contours detected in the input image.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Caliper.IArcCaliperTool.EdgeFilterHalfWidth
member.summary: Half-width of the convolution filter used to compute the edge magnitude curve from which actual edges are detected. The filter approximates the first derivative of the projection curve. The half-width of the filter should be set in order to match the width of the edge in the projection curve (the extent of the grey-scale transition, expressed in number of pixels).

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Caliper.IArcCaliperTool.MagnitudeThreshold
member.summary: Magnitude threshold is used to find edges on the magnitude curve. A subpixel peak detection algorithm is applied on the region of every minimum or maximum of the curve that exceeds this threshold in order to locate edges.

member.summary: Subsampling level used to detect edges that are used by the tool to generate hypotheses. High values provide a coarser search and lower execution time than lower values.

member.summary: Gets or sets the conformity tolerance configuration

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Finder.ILineFinderTool.MaximumAngleDeviation
member.summary: Maximum deviation relates to the deviation in angle between hypothesis and the line found by the tool. By default the Line Finder accepts a 20 degree deviation. However, the tool uses the defined MaximumAngleDeviation value to test the hypothesis and refine the pose of the found line.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Finder.ILineFinderTool.PositioningLevel
member.summary: Configurable effort level of the entity positioning process. A value of 10 will provide coarser positioning and lower execution time. Conversely, a value of 100 will provide high accuracy positioning of line entities

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Finder.ILineFinderTool.PolarityMode
member.summary: Selects the type of polarity accepted for finding a line. Polarity identifies the change in greylevel values along the tool's X axis, in the positive direction.

member.summary: Minimum percentage of line contours that need to be matched for a line hypothesis to be considered as valid.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Finder.ILineFinderTool.SearchMode
member.summary: Specifies the method used by the tool to select a hypothesis.

member.summary: Results of an line finder tool execution

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Finder.LineFinderResults.fitQuality
member.summary: Normalized average error between the calculated line and the actual edges matched to the found line. Fit quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the average error is 0. Conversely, a value of 0 means that the average matched error is equal to conformity tolerance.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Finder.LineFinderResults.FitQuality
member.summary: Normalized average error between the calculated line and the actual edges matched to the found line. Fit quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the average error is 0. Conversely, a value of 0 means that the average matched error is equal to conformity tolerance.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Finder.LineFinderResults.matchQuality
member.summary: Percentage of edges actually matched to the found line. Match Quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that edges were matched for every point along the found line. Similarly, a value of 0.2 means edges were matched to 20% of the points along the found line.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Finder.LineFinderResults.MatchQuality
member.summary: Percentage of edges actually matched to the found line. Match Quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that edges were matched for every point along the found line. Similarly, a value of 0.2 means edges were matched to 20% of the points along the found line.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Finder.LineFinderResults.averageContrast
member.summary: Average contrast between light and dark pixels on either side of the found line, expressed in greylevel values.

member.summary: Average contrast between light and dark pixels on either side of the found line, expressed in greylevel values.

member.summary: Return the region of interest of the tool as a rectangle

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorModel.OriginOffset
member.summary: The position in the world coordinate system of the selected model's origin. The origin, defined by the ModelOriginPositionX, ModelOriginPositionY , and ModelOriginRotation properties, is used by the Locator to express the pose of instances of the model. The translation of the instance represents the position of the model's origin in the coordinate system selected by the CoordinateSystem property. The model's origin is also used as the pivot point around which the rotation of the instance is measured. This origin also defines the object coordinate system that can be used to express results of model-based inspection tools.

member.summary: Gets or sets the contrast threshold level

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.ContourDetection
member.summary: Sets how the contour detection parameters are configured. When set to hsContourParametersAllModels, the contour detection parameters are optimized by analyzing the parameters used to build all the models. When set to hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters are set manually. When set to a value greater than hsContourParametersCustom, the contour detection parameters of a specific model are used. The contour detection parameters on which this property has an effect are DetailLevel, OutlineLevel, ContrastThresholdMode, and ContrastThreshold

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.ModelDisambiguationEnabled
member.summary: When set to True (default), the Locator applies disambiguation to discriminate between similar models and between similar hypotheses of a single object. When set to False, the Locator does not apply disambiguation.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.ModelOptimizerEnabled
member.summary: Model optimization enabled

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.PercentageOfPointsToAnalyze
member.summary: Percentage of points to analyze

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.ContrastPolarity
member.summary: Selects the type of polarity accepted for object recognition. Contrast polarity identifies the direction of change in greylevel values between an object and its surrounding area. Polarity is always defined with respect to the initial polarity in the image on which the Model was created.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.InstanceOrdering
member.summary: Order in which the instances are processed and output.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.MinimumClearance
member.summary: When MinimumClearPercentageEnabled is set to true, MinimumClearPercentage sets the minimum percentage of the model bounding box area that must be free of obstacles to consider an object instance as valid.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.MinimumRequiredFeatures
member.summary: Minimum percentage of required features that must be recognized in order to consider the object instance as valid.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.OutputSymmetricInstances
member.summary: When set to true, all the symmetric pose of the object instances are output. If False, only the best quality of the symmetric poses of the object instance is output.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.PositioningLevel
member.summary: Configurable effort level of the instance positioning process. A value of 0 will provide coarser positioning and lower execution time. Conversely, a value of 10 will provide high accuracy positioning of object instances.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.RecognitionLevel
member.summary: Configurable effort level of the search process. A value of 0 will lead to a faster search that may miss instances that are partly occluded. Conversely, a value of 10 is useful for finding partly occluded objects in cluttered or noisy images, or for models made up of small features at the Outline Level.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.SearchBasedOnOutlineLevelOnly
member.summary: When set to True, the Locator does not use the models at the Detail level for the positioning process. This mode can be used to improve the speed when only a coarse positioning of object instances is required

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.Timeout
member.summary: Time (in milliseconds) after which the Locator tool aborts its search process. This timeout period does not include the model learning phase. When the timeout is reached and TimeoutEnabled is set to True, the instances recognized up to the timeout are output by the Locator and the search is aborted.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.ConformityTolerance
member.summary: Maximum number of object instances that are searched for in the input grey-scale Image. All of the object instances respecting the search constraints are output, up to a maximum of MaximumInstanceCount . They are ordered according to the InstanceOrdering property

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.OverlapConfiguration
member.summary: Maximum number of object instances that are searched for in the input grey-scale Image. All of the object instances respecting the search constraints are output, up to a maximum of MaximumInstanceCount . They are ordered according to the InstanceOrdering property

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.MaximumInstanceCount
member.summary: Maximum number of object instances that are searched for in the input grey-scale Image. All of the object instances respecting the search constraints are output, up to a maximum of MaximumInstanceCount . They are ordered according to the InstanceOrdering property

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.MinimumModelPercentage
member.summary: Minimum percentage of model contours that need to be matched in the input image in order to consider the object instance as valid.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.NominalRotation
member.summary: Specifies whether the rotation of a recognized instance must fall within the range set by MinimumRotation and MaximumRotation or be equal to the nominal value set by the NominalRotation property. When NominalRotationEnabled is set to True, the nominal value is applied, otherwise the range is used.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.ILocatorTool.NominalScaleFactor
member.summary: Required scale factor for an object instance to be recognized.

member.summary: Required scale factor for an object instance to be recognized.

member.summary: InstanceLocation returns the location of the selected instance, in the frame of reference of the specified robot. If a gripper offset has been assigned to the instance, it is automatically applied to the location. If no robot-to-vision calibration has been carried out, InstanceLocation returns the location in the Vision frame of reference.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.LocatorInstance.fitQuality
member.summary: Normalized average error between the matched model contours of the selected object instance and the actual contours detected in the input image. Fit quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the average error is 0. Conversely, a value of 0 means that the average matched error is equal to conformity tolerance.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.LocatorInstance.FitQuality
member.summary: Normalized average error between the matched model contours of the selected object instance and the actual contours detected in the input image. Fit quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that the average error is 0. Conversely, a value of 0 means that the average matched error is equal to conformity tolerance.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.LocatorInstance.matchQuality

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Locator.LocatorInstance.MatchQuality
member.summary: Amount of matched model contours for the selected object instance. Match quality ranges from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best quality. A value of 1 means that 100% of the model contours were successfully matched to the actual contours detected in the input image.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IImageHistogramTool.ThresholdBlack
member.summary: Black sets the threshold for excluding dark pixels. All pixels with a greylevel value lower than the threshold value are excluded from the histogram.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IImageHistogramTool.ThresholdWhite
member.summary: White sets the threshold for excluding light pixels. All pixels with a greylevel value higher than the threshold value are excluded from the histogram.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IImageHistogramTool.TailWhite
member.summary: A White tail specifies the amount of light pixels to exclude from the histogram, starting from the light end of the histogram distribution (255). The amount of pixels to exclude is expressed as a percentage of the total number of pixels in the tool's region of interest.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IImageHistogramTool.TailBlack
member.summary: A Black tail specifies the amount of dark pixels to exclude from the histogram, starting from the dark end of the histogram distribution (0). The amount of pixels to exclude is expressed as a percentage of the total number of pixels in the tool's region of interest.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IImageHistogramTool.ImageSubSampling
member.summary: Use the Image Subsampling slider to set a subsampling level from 1, which means no subsampling, to 8, where a subsampled pixel represents a tile of 8 by 8 pixels in the original image.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IImageHistogramTool.CustomSamplingStep
member.summary: Is the custom sampling step enabled

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IImageHistogramTool.BilinearInterpolationEnabled
member.summary: Use the Bilinear Interpolation check box to enable bilinear interpolated sampling of the tool's region of interest. Bilinear sampling is slower than uninterpolated sampling but should always be enabled when subpixel accuracy is required.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool
member.summary: Vision tool for the multi region image histogram. Adds and analyzes histogram tools to get the multi region image histogram results.

member.summary: Offset from the parent input link, if defined, or origin at which we throw the tool

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.SelectedHistogramIndex
member.summary: Index for the selected histogram being edited

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.ThresholdBlack
member.summary: Black sets the threshold for excluding dark pixels. All pixels with a greylevel value lower than the threshold value are excluded from the histogram.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.ThresholdWhite
member.summary: White sets the threshold for excluding light pixels. All pixels with a greylevel value higher than the threshold value are excluded from the histogram.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.TailWhite
member.summary: A White tail specifies the amount of light pixels to exclude from the histogram, starting from the light end of the histogram distribution (255). The amount of pixels to exclude is expressed as a percentage of the total number of pixels in the tool's region of interest.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.TailBlack
member.summary: A Black tail specifies the amount of dark pixels to exclude from the histogram, starting from the dark end of the histogram distribution (0). The amount of pixels to exclude is expressed as a percentage of the total number of pixels in the tool's region of interest.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Vision.Tools.Processing.IMultiRegionImageHistogramTool.BilinearInterpolationEnabled
member.summary: Use the Bilinear Interpolation check box to enable bilinear interpolated sampling of the tool's region of interest. Bilinear sampling is slower than uninterpolated sampling but should always be enabled when subpixel accuracy is required.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Xpert.PackXpert.Runtime.LocatedInstanceCollection.BeltInstanceComparer
member.summary: Comparer object used to sort instances based on their position on the belt. Pallets are a special case: 1. Pallets must always be accessed in the order of the indexes within a pallet. 2. Pallets must be sorted relative to each other and accessed in the order of appearance on the conveyor. (i.e. FIFO order). Depending on how the pallet is taught, the slots in the pallet will not necessarily be in order of the distance to the pick limit. Additionally, pallets may overlap.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Xpert.PackXpert.Processes.IPartProcess.IsTaught
member.summary: Gets or sets if the process has been taught
member.remarks: When a process or a related component is modified, the process manager owning the process will scan through all the dependencies of the process and will force the value of the process teach status. If all calibrations and configuration items have been taught, the process is considered taught. If something has not been taught, the process will be considered not taught.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Xpert.PackXpert.ProcessStrategies.IProcessStrategy.AllocationDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay between calls to the allocation algorithm.
member.remarks: This parameter can dramatically affect the processor utilization. If a lot of instances are being tracked or there are a large number of vision operations, your processor utilization may be unacceptably high. Increasing the delay between allocations can lower the processor utilization and result in a better performing system.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Euler
member.summary: Defines the order of Euler angles that are supported by the Transform3D class.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Euler.Xyz
member.summary: X-Y-Z Euler angles, in which the order of rotations is a rotation about X, followed by a rotation about the "new" Y axis after the initial rotation, followed by a rotation about the "new" Z axis.

member.name: F:Ace.Server.Euler.Zyz
member.summary: Z-Y-Z Euler angles, in which the order of rotations is a rotation about Z, followed by a rotation about the "new" Y axis after the initial rotation, followed by a rotation about the "new" Z axis.

member.name: T:Ace.Server.Transform3D
member.summary: A "homogeneous transformation", which describes the offset and orientation of one XYZ coordinate system from another as a single entity.
member.remarks:
An affine, non-scaling transform may be written as
[ xAxis.X yAxis.X zAxis.X offset.X ] [ xAxis.Y yAxis.Y zAxis.Y offset.Y ] [ xAxis.Z yAxis.Z zAxis.Z offset.Z ] [ 0 0 0 1 ]
where xAxis, yAxis, and zAxis are unit vectors specifying the new XYZ axes in the coordinate system of the old XYZ axes, and offset specifies the offset of the new origin from the old origin, along the old axes. A Transform3D is immutable--once defined, it cannot be changed. This makes it behave much as a value type.

member.name: P:Ace.Server.Transform3D.DefaultEulerAngles
member.summary: Default Euler angles selection used when displaying and converting transforms. The default is "Z-Y-Z".

member.name: T:Ace.Services.Synchronization.CompressionConfiguration
member.summary: Represents the parameters used to configure synchronization compression behavior.

member.name: P:Ace.Services.Synchronization.CompressionConfiguration.SupportedFormats
member.summary: Gets or sets the supported compression formats.
member.remarks: This sets the compression formats that are supported by the endpoint (client or server). When a session is opened the client uses the list of formats supported by the server to determine which format to use during the subsequent data transfers. If no formats are listed then compression is effectively disabled.

member.name: P:Ace.Services.Synchronization.CompressionConfiguration.RequestedFormats
member.summary: Gets or sets the requested compression formats.
member.remarks: This collection determines the compression formats that will be requested by the client. The client matches this list with the set of supported compression formats reported by the server. The requested formats should be listed in order of preference.

member.name: P:Ace.Services.Synchronization.CompressionConfiguration.SendThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the send threshold.
member.remarks: This value is compared with the size of the data to be sent (in bytes). Any item exceeding this threshold will be compressed according to the applicable compression format.

member.name: P:Ace.Services.Synchronization.CompressionConfiguration.ReceiveThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the receive threshold.
member.remarks: This value is compared with the size of the data to be received (in bytes). Any item exceeding this threshold will be compressed according to the applicable compression format.

member.name: T:Ace.Services.Synchronization.CompressionFormat
member.summary: Defines the available compression formats.
member.remarks: This enum forms part of a WCF contract so do not change any existing values. However new values can be added.

member.name: F:Ace.Services.Synchronization.CompressionFormat.None
member.summary: No compression.

member.name: F:Ace.Services.Synchronization.CompressionFormat.GZip
member.summary: The GZip compression format.

member.summary: Indicates there is no fault.

member.name: F:Ace.Services.Synchronization.OpenFaultCode.CannotCreateSession
member.summary: Indicates that the session cannot be created because another application has already opened an incompatible session. This can occur when both applications request write access at the same time or when one application has already been granted write access and another request requires the current solution to be closed.

member.name: F:Ace.Services.Synchronization.OpenFaultCode.InvalidRuntimeStopMethod
member.summary: Indicates that the requested stop method is not compatible with the requested operation. This can occur in the case where an operation requires the runtime to be stopped but there is no request to do so.

member.name: F:Ace.Services.Synchronization.OpenFaultCode.ErrorCreatingSolution
member.summary: Indicates there was an error when trying to create a new solution.

member.name: F:Ace.Services.Synchronization.OpenFaultCode.ErrorOpeningSolution
member.summary: Indicates there was an error whilst opening a solution.

member.name: F:Ace.Services.Synchronization.OpenFaultCode.SolutionNotFound
member.summary: Indicates that the solution was not found.

member.name: F:Ace.Services.Synchronization.OpenFaultCode.InvalidRequest
member.summary: The request has some invalid property values

member.name: F:Ace.Services.Synchronization.OpenFaultCode.SessionNotFound
member.summary: The session cannot be found.

member.name: F:Ace.Services.Synchronization.OpenFaultCode.FeatureNotSupported
member.summary: The feature is not supported

member.name: F:Ace.Services.Synchronization.OpenFaultCode.InvalidAccessLevel
member.summary: The access level does not allow synchronization to proceed. Typically this occurs when a user with access mode higher than is signed in.

member.name: M:Ace.Util.RemotingUtil.NewTcpChannel(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a TCP channel that allows delegates to register across app domains. Default security doesn't allow this, since it won't allow serialization of delegates.
member.param: if set to true this is a client side port.

member.name: M:Ace.Util.RemotingUtil.CreateServerChannels(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create the communication channels required by a server. Currently there are 2 connection channels created: 'ipc' and 'tcp'. For each channel type, 2 channels are needed. One is tied to a specific port so a client can access the server. The other is used for callbacks to the client on a secondary channel.
member.param: Port at which object is to be registered.

member.name: M:Ace.Util.SerializationUtil.GetDefaultFormatter(System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a formatter for the specified serialization type.

The streaming context to use, if any. Defaults to null.

member.name: M:Ace.Util.SerializationUtil.AddValue(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.String,System.Double,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Adds a double-precision floating-point value into the store.
member.param: The name to associate with the value, so it can be deserialized later.
Describes the source and destination of the serialized stream.
member.remarks: If the reason for serialization is hash generation then we need to use a format that is accurate and unambiguous. Standard serialization of double precision floating point values is to a decimal string representation which can exist in many equivalent forms e.g. 12.1 1.2E1, 1.2e1 etc. For hash calculation we use the IEEE binary value converted to a 64 bit integer value.

member.param: The name to associate with the value, so it can be deserialized later.
Describes the source and destination of the serialized stream.
member.remarks: If the reason for serialization is hash generation then we need to use a format that is accurate and unambiguous. Standard serialization of double precision floating point values is to a decimal string representation which can exist in many equivalent forms e.g. 12.1 1.2E1, 1.2e1 etc. For hash calculation we use the IEEE binary value converted to a 64 bit integer value.

Standard serialization of single precision floating point values is to a decimal string representation which can exist in many equivalent forms e.g. 12.1 1.2E1, 1.2e1 etc. For hash calculation we use the IEEE binary value converted to a 32 bit integer value.
